snippet.title: Grasping Victoria's new school gradings
snippet.content:
RAISING THE BAR ON VICTORIA'S SCHOOL RESULTS: Grade/Old School Score/New School Score A = 85-100 per cent = 18 months ahead of age group B = 75-84 per cent = six-to-12 months ahead of age group C = 65-74 per cent = working at the same level as age peers D = 50-64 per cent = six-to-12 months behind age group E = n/a = 12-to-18 months behind age group
Related Articles
F = less than 50 per cent = n/a NOTE: There have been progressive changes to the school grading system, not shown in this table. Schools can choose to create their own five-point system, using scales such as "outstanding" and "unsatisfactory". (C) AAP 2017
